conclusion: The problem asks if the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
The v-t graph shows velocity changes from +2 m/s to 0 m/s between 0 and 2 seconds, and then to -2 m/s at 3 seconds.
From 0 to 1 second, velocity is +2 m/s, resulting in a displacement of +2 m.
From 1 to 2 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from +2 m/s to 0 m/s, average velocity is +1 m/s, resulting in a displacement of +1 m.
Position after 2 seconds is +3 m from the starting point.
From 2 to 3 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s, average velocity is -1 m/s, resulting in a displacement of -1 m.
Position after 3 seconds is +2 m from the starting point.
Since the net displacement is +2 m, the particle has not returned to the starting point.
